p.d: Marin Alsop conducts the Britten-Pears Orchestra in a performance of Benjamin Britten's The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra. This performance took place at Snape Maltings Concert Hall, Snape Bridge in the UK in 2017. The Britten-Pears Young Artist Programme was founded over 40 years ago by the composer and Peter Pears, to provide high-level performance training for the world's best emerging professional musicians. Ever since the 1946 the educational film 'Instruments of the Orchestra', generations have been inspired by Britten's much-loved classic.
